source.instructions: Which of the following is an example of thinking computationally?

answers.answer: When going to meet a friend, wandering around until you find them
Planning out your route when going to meet a friend

source.name: QuizQuestion9
source.instructions: Which of these is not a way that the internet has impacted personal communication?

answers.answer: Having many ways to communicate online builds personal relationships.
Constant, ongoing communication makes people feel closer.
Using modern technology makes people feel important.
People share more details of their lives and understand each other better.

source.name: QuizQuestion10
source.instructions: In which of these ways can technology have a negative affect on health?

answers.answer: Sitting in one position for an extended period can cause muscle strain and blood clots.
Using the computer to type letters is not as personal as writing them.
Monitor devices can send alerts to a phone when attention is needed.
Step Counters such as fitbit encourage more active lifestyles.

source.name: QuizQuestion12
source.instructions: What is one reason a company would split people into categories based on their data?

answers.answer:
To send mail to all of the people in every category.
-
To determine what items they are most likely to buy.

source.name: QuizQuestion13
source.instructions: If a device is having problems, which is not a step in troubleshooting?

answers.answer: Turning it off then back on.
Clicking lots of random places until it responds.
Replacing components to find the part that is not working.
